conclusion: To determine if the distance fallen is greater or less than 100 meters, calculate the area under the v-t graph for 0 to 10 seconds.
The graph shows velocity on the y-axis and time on the x-axis. The skydiver's velocity increases from 0 to a peak and then decreases.
We are interested in the time interval from 0 to 10 seconds.
The graph shows velocity increasing roughly linearly from 0 to 20 m/s over the 0 to 10 seconds interval, forming a triangular shape.
Calculate the area of the triangle using the formula: Area = 1/2 * base * height.
The base is 10 seconds, and the height is 20 m/s, so the area is 100 square meters.
The area under the graph from 0 to 10 seconds is 100 square meters. The actual distance is slightly greater than the triangular approximation.
The distance fallen during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is slightly greater than 100 meters.
